Sentence.sentence: Middle school is an important age because students have enough math capability to solve advanced problems, but they haven't really decided what they want to do with their lives, said Loh.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And it is clearly up to the current generation of leaders from high-emitting nations to decide whether they  want to be remembered as climate change tyrants or pioneers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That will help you decide which items are really worth it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: She decided to take lunch to work instead.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When you hear people speaking of making a rapid transition toward any type of energy, whether it is a switch from coal to nuclear power, or a switch from gasoline-powered cars to electric cars, or even a switch from an incandescent to a fluorescent light, understanding energy system inertia and momentum can help you decide whether their plans are feasible.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The researchers decided to go deeper, however.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Should doctors consider Medicare's budget in deciding what to use?I think ethically（在道德层面上） we are just worried about the patient in front of us and not trying to save money for the insurance industry or society as a whole, said Dr.Donald Jensen.Still
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In practical terms, the new guidelines being develop could result in doctors choosing one drug over another for cost reasons or even deciding that a particular treatment — at the end of life, for example — is too expensive.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When supervisors give employees an unfavorable evaluation, they must decide whether to take any additional actions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rather than pay up or work out a settlement, Bowman decided to appeal—all the way to the Supreme Court.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: An influential figure decided to move from the countryside to the city.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As a measure to counter future shortages, the American government decided to establish a stockpile of oil in caves underground
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: First, we decide whether we are superior or inferior to others on certain dimensions, such as attractiveness, intelligence, popularity, etc.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That issue is already decided.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But the idea that institutions or their students must decide between humanities and science is false.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The man has decided to quit his computer class
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice overtime
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I can't decide what to do for my summer vacation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I'll give you a free path so that you can try out the facilities before you decide
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Question 11: What do the speakers decide to do?
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What did Janet James decide to do after her disease was diagnosed
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And since she wants to go back to work, I've decided to take a year off to raise the baby.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Oh, I can't decide right now because I have to find out more about the other candidates.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When Andrea found a job with a school district closer to her mother's home in West Jordan, Utah, the family decided to move on.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The man has decided to choose Language Studies as his major.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In America, people are faced with more and more decisions every day, whether it's picking one of thirty-one ice cream flavors, or deciding whether and when to get married.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Juan Louis, a junior geology major, decided to give an informative speech about how earthquakes occur.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Since he was speaking in the Midwest, he decided to begin by noting that the most severe earthquake in American history took place not in California or Alaska but at New Madrid, Missouri in
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: At least taxpayers should be able to decide what students will study on the public dime.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: But when two H-bots became imperiled, the robot choked 42 percent of the time, unable to decide which to save and letting them both.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: If you are at home trying to decide where to go for dinner, however, the knowledge component may prevail, and you decide to go where you can eat a healthier meal.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: In the beginning of the movie I, Robot, a robot has to decide whom to save after two cars plunge into the water— Del Spooner or a child.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It will decide on the Weddell Sea sanctuary proposal at a conference in Australia in October, although a decision on the peninsula sanctuary is not expected until later.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: It's important to note that robotic nurses don't decide courses of treatment or make diagnosesthough robot doctors and surgeons may not be far of.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So please tell us, why did you decide to open a café?
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: The experiment highlights the importance of morality: without it, how can a robot decide whom to save or what's best for humanity, especially if it can't calculate survival odds?
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The first thing every bank will do is study how much money I have and how much debt I have before they decide whether or not to lend me any more money.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: We are not the ones to decide on the establishment of marine protected areas, but we hope to contribute positively with our knowledge and experience.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: When you hear people speaking of making a rapid transition toward any type of energy, whether it is a switch from coal to nuclear power, or a switch from gasoline -powered cars to electric cars, or even a switch from an incandescent to a fluorescent light
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"决定"之意。
means: decide ： 侧重指经过思考、比较、讨论或询问之后做出的决定。
determine ： 指经过深思熟虑，决心去做某事并坚持施行。
resolve ： 语气较强，强调以坚定不移的信念去做或不做某事，暗含有远大抱负和坚强决心。
settle ： 指排除犹豫、怀疑和争论之后作出明确的最终结论。

stems_affixes.word_buile: insect昆虫+cide切开,杀→杀虫的[东西]

Sentence.sentence: But, the wonderful thing about failure is that it's entirely up to us to decide how to look at it.

Sentence.sentence: She adds, however, that "to decide is to kill off all possibilities but one."
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They would try to decide what intelligence in humans is really for, not merely how much of it there is.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

entry.def: If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities.

example.ex: She decided to do a secretarial course...
example.tran: 她决定修一门文秘课程。

example.ex: He has decided that he doesn't want to embarrass the movement and will therefore step down...
example.tran: 他已拿定主意：他不想令运动陷入困窘的境地，因此决心辞职。

entry.def: If a person or group of people decides something, they choose what something should be like or how a particular problem should be solved.

example.ex: She was still young, he said, and that would be taken into account when deciding her sentence...
example.tran: 他说，她还年轻，而这一点在对她量刑时将会予以考虑。

example.ex: This is an issue that should be decided by local and metropolitan government.
example.tran: 这个问题应该由当地及大都市政府共同解决。

entry.def: If an event or fact decides something, it makes it certain that a particular choice will be made or that there will be a particular result.
entry.tran: （事件或事实）决定，确定（某一选择或结果)

example.ex: The goal that decided the match came just before the interval...
example.tran: 决定本场比赛结果的进球是在中场休息前一刻打入的。

example.ex: The results will decide if he will win a place at a good university...
example.tran: 这些成绩将决定他能否上一所好大学。

entry.def: If you decide that something is true, you form that opinion about it after considering the facts.

example.ex: He decided Franklin must be suffering from a bad cold...
example.tran: 他断定富兰克林一定是得了重感冒。

example.ex: I couldn't decide whether he was incredibly brave or just insane.
example.tran: 我不能判定他到底是英勇无畏还是精神失常。

entry.def: If something decides you to do something, it is the reason that causes you to choose to do it.

example.ex: The banning of his play decided him to write about censorship...
example.tran: 他的戏剧被禁演，这促使他下定决心就审查制度的问题下笔。

example.ex: I don't know what finally decided her, but she agreed.
example.tran: 我不知道是什么让她最终拿定了主意，但她还是同意了。

means.word_mean: 1. reach, make, or come to a decision about something;
2. bring to an end; settle conclusively;

sentences.sentence: "The judge decided the case in favor of the plaintiff"
"The father adjudicated when the sons were quarreling over their inheritance"
"The vote in New Hampshire often decides the outcome of the Presidential election"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'bring to a settlement'): from French décider, from Latin decidere 'determine', from de- 'off' + caedere 'cut'

means: 成为（某人）做某事的原因

sentences.cn: 已经决定学校要购买新软件。
sentences.en: It was decided (that) the school should purchase new software.

sentences.cn: 这案件将由陪审团裁决。
sentences.en: The case will be decided by a jury.

sentences.cn: 上诉法院作出了有利于他们的裁定。
sentences.en: The Appeal Court decided in their favour .

sentences.cn: 法官判你败诉总是有可能的。
sentences.en: It is always possible that the judge may decide against you.

sentences.cn: 技术和运气结合在一起决定了比赛的结果。
sentences.en: A mixture of skill and good luck decided the outcome of the game.

sentences.cn: 一部电影成功与否是由许多因素决定的。
sentences.en: A number of factors decide whether a movie will be successful or not.

sentences.cn: 他们愿意免费为我提供一年的住宿，这就使我下定了决心。
sentences.en: They offered me free accommodation for a year, and that decided me.

sentences.cn: 我们仍然在设法选定一个会场。
sentences.en: We're still trying to decide on a venue.

sentences.cn: 我们或许会再多雇些人，不过现在什么都还没定下来。
sentences.en: We might be hiring more people but nothing has been decided yet.

sentences.cn: 我们到底还是决定不离开。
sentences.en: We've decided not to go away after all.

sentences.cn: 他们决定不提起诉讼。

sentences.cn: 很难在这两个候选人之间决定取舍。
sentences.en: It was difficult to decide between the two candidates.

sentences.cn: 他们决定不提起诉讼。
sentences.en: They decided against taking legal action.

sentences.cn: 这事由你来决定吧。
sentences.en: It's up to you to decide.

sentences.cn: 她决定修一门文秘课程。
sentences.en: She decided to do a secretarial course...

sentences.cn: 决定本场比赛结果的进球是在中场休息前一刻打入的。
sentences.en: The goal that decided the match came just before the interval...

sentences.cn: 这些成绩将决定他能否上一所好大学。
sentences.en: The results will decide if he will win a place at a good university...

sentences.cn: 当然，诺贝尔奖也是由一个非常有钱的人设立的，他决定用自己的钱做自己想做的事。
sentences.en: The Nobels were, of course, themselves set up by a very rich individual who had decided what he wanted to do with his own money.

sentences.cn: 这种急剧下降是美国鱼类及野生动物管理局（USFWS)决定正式将该鸟类列为受威胁物种的主要原因。
sentences.en: The crash was a major reason the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS)decided to formally list the bird as threatened .

sentences.cn: 然而，研究者们决定进行深入研究。
sentences.en: The researchers decided to go deeper, however.

sentences.cn: 但是，如果你是在家里，试图定下吃晚餐的地点，知识成分就有可能 (35) 占上风，此时你会决定去一个你能享用更健康餐食的地方。
sentences.en: If you are at home trying to decide where to go for dinner, however, the knowledge component may 35 prevail, and you decide to go where you can eat a healthier meal.

sentences.cn: “初中是一个重要的阶段，因为学生有足够的数学能力来解决难题，但他们还没真正决定想要怎么过自己的人生，”Loh说
sentences.en: “Middle school is an important age because students have enough math capability to solve advanced problems, but they haven’t really decided what they want to do with their lives,” said Loh.

sentences.cn: 在时装设计学院读大四的时候，我需要上交一个系列作品，于是决定尝试在家用 3D打印技术制作一整个系列的时装。
sentences.en: For  my  senior collection  at  fashion  design  school,  I decided  to  try  and  3D  print  an  entire fashion  collection  from  my  home.

sentences.cn: Barrett 想要弄明白，实体货币的消失是否真的会使人花更多的钱，所以在几个月前她决定进行一个实验。
sentences.en: Barrett wanted to find out if the absence of physical currency does indeed cause a person to spend more, so she decided to conduct an experiment a few months ago.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 她决定在两周时间内只用现金来完成所有的基本购物，看看这对她的花销有什么影响。
sentences.en: She decided that she was going to try to just use cash for two weeks to make all of her essential purchases and see what that would do to her spending.

sentences.cn: 她决定自己带午餐到公司。
sentences.en: She  decided to  take  lunch  to  work  instead

sentences.cn: 这个女儿担心自己的母亲在那里会被忽视，所以她决定送母亲去一个对待入住者更热情的机构。

sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 总的来说，人们认为自己付出的行动和努力，而不是外界力量，是生活如何发展的决定因素。但是对于怎样做才能在当前的经济形势下过上更好的生活，受访者百感交集。
sentences.en: By and large, people felt that their actions and hard work—not outside forces—were the deciding factor in how their lives turned out. But respondents had decidedly mixed feelings about what actions make for a better life in the current economy.
sentences.from: 17年12月四级真题(第三套)| 阅读

sentences.cn: 1910年，奥林匹克号首先启航，之后是1911年泰坦尼克号启航，最后不列颠尼克号于1914年启航。 [52]这些邮轮有九层甲板，白星航运公司决定将它们重点打造成海上最为奢华的邮轮。
sentences.en: The Olympic launched first in 1910, followed by the Titanic in 1911, and lastly the Britannic in 1914. The ships had nine decks, and White Star Line decided to focus on making them the most luxurious ships on the water.
